# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.09bd333a:
from plotly.offline import download_plotlyjs, init_notebook_mode, plot, iplot
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)

# importing data visualization library
import matplotlib.pyplot as pt
import plotly.graph_objects as go

%matplotlib inline
source.7c3d5cbc:
# reading data
df1 = pd.read_csv("../input/bangladesh-cricket-team-yearly-performance/Bangladesh Cricket Team Yearly Result Summary (Test).csv")
source.d6f33e22:
df2= pd.read_csv("../input/bangladesh-cricket-team-yearly-performance/Bangladesh Cricket Team Yearly Result Summary (ODI).csv")
df3= pd.read_csv("../input/bangladesh-cricket-team-yearly-performance/Bangladesh Cricket Team Yearly Result Summary (T-20).csv")
source.b71178ab:
#plotting the test matches dataset
x=df1[df1["Total Matches"] != 0]["Year"]
y = df1[df1["Total Matches"] != 0]["Total Matches"]
                    


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y,
                    text = y,
                    textposition = "auto"))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Year Wise Total Matches (Test)",
                              font_size = 25
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.e1998855:
x=df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Year"]
y = df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Won"]
                    


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y,
                    text = y,
                    textposition = "auto"))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Year Wise Total Matches Won (Test)",
                              font_size = 25
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Won Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.92f8c1eb:
#test total matches vs total wins yearwise
x=df1[df1["Total Matches"] != 0]["Year"]
y1 = df1[df1["Total Matches"] != 0]["Total Matches"]
y2 = df1[df1["Total Matches"] != 0]["Won"]


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y1,
                    name = "Total Matches"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y2,
                    name = "Won Matches"
                    ))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Total Matches vs Won by Bangladesh",
                              font_size = 20
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.871236e2:
#test total matches vs total  home wins yearwise
x=df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Year"]
y1 = df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Won"]
y2 = df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Home wins"]


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y1,
                    name = "Total Matches"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y2,
                    name = "Won Matches"
                    ))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Total Matches won vs Won in Home ground by Bangladesh",
                              font_size = 20
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.cb9a9976:
#test total matches wins vs total  away wins yearwise
x=df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Year"]
y1 = df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Won"]
y2 = df1[df1["Won"] != 0]["Away wins"]


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y1,
                    name = "Total Matches Won"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y2,
                    name = "Away Won Matches"
                    ))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Total Matches won vs Won in away ground by Bangladesh",
                              font_size = 20
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.70c1c37e:
#yearwise home wins vs away wins
x=df1[df1["Home wins"] != 0]["Year"]
y1 = df1[df1["Home wins"] != 0]["Home wins"]
y2 = df1[df1["Home wins"] != 0]["Away wins"]


fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y1,
                    name = "Home Matches Won"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=x,
                    y = y2,
                    name = "Away Matches Won"
                    ))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Total Matches won Home vs Won in away ground by Bangladesh",
                              font_size = 20
                              ),
                 yaxis = dict(title = "Number of Matches"),
                 xaxis = dict(title = "Year"))
source.3c932ba2:
#total wins, home wins and away wins in test
totalwins = df1["Won"].sum()
homewins= df1["Home wins"].sum()
awaywins= df1["Away wins"].sum()

x = ["Won", "Home wins", "Away wins" ]
y = [totalwins, homewins, awaywins]

fig = go.Figure()

fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x= x,
                    y = y))

fig.update_layout(title = dict(text = "Comparision between total wins, home wins and away wins")
                 )
source.935850f5:
x=df1["Year"]

y2 = df1["Total Matches"]
y3 = df1["Won"]
y4 = df1["Home wins"]
y5 = df1["Away wins"]



fig = go.Figure()


fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x,
                    y = y2,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Total Matches"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x,
                    y = y3,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Total wins"
                    ))

fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x,
                    y = y4,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Total home wins"
                    ))
fig.add_trace(go.Scatter(x=x,
                    y = y5,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Total away wins"
                    ))

                    y = y3,
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "Total wins"
                    ))
